info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 5:51PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Luzerne County through 630 PM EDT... At 551 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mountain Top, or 10 miles southwest of Wilkes-Barre, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Freeland, Dorrance, White Haven, Nuangola, Penn Lake Park, Jeddo, Mountain Top, Woodside-Drifton, Drifton and Nescopeck State Park. This includes the following highway exits... Interstate 80 between 262 and 273. Pennsylvania Interstate 81 between 151A and B and 159. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
